taxon_name.authority: A. Gray in W. H. Emory

place_of_publication.publication_title: in W. H. Emory, Rep. U.S. Mex. Bound.

taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe heliantheae;subtribe ambrosiinae;genus parthenium;species argentatum

bio:treatment.description: Shrubs, 30–100+ cm. Leaf blades lanceolate to oblanceolate, 15–25(–40+) × 6–15(–25+) mm, margins mostly entire, some with 1–2(–5) sharp teeth, faces densely strigillose (gray to white) and obscurely or not at all gland-dotted. Heads radiate, in glomerules of 3–5+ at ends of ± ebracteate stalks 8–15(–20+) cm. Peduncles 1–2(–6+) mm. Phyllaries: outer 5 oval-elliptic, 2.5–3+ mm, inner 5 ± orbiculate, 3.5–4 mm. Pistillate florets 5; corolla laminae ovate, 1.2–1.5 mm. Disc florets 20–30+. Cypselae ± obovoid, 2.5–3 mm; pappus-like enations 2(–4), erect to spreading, ± subulate, 0.3–0.8 mm. 2n = 36.

verbatim.text: Flowering Apr–Jun. Calcareous soils; 1000–1500 m; Tex.; Mexico.

bio:treatment.discussion: Guayule has sometimes been used for commercial production of natural rubber. Hybrids between Parthenium argentatum and P. incanum have been noted.
